definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
to remain calm in the face of adversity (idiom)
silicosis (occupational disease of miners)/grinder's disease/also written 矽末病

sentences.english: I like working with John because he's so calm and equable .
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡和約翰一起工作，因爲他性情沉著穩重。

sentences.english: Nerves of Cold Steel is now a Tier 1 talent, down from Tier 2.
sentences.chinese: 冷鋼沉著現在從二階天賦降爲一階天賦。

sentences.english: On the field his demeanour is steely and calm.
sentences.chinese: 在球場上，王建民是鋼鐵般的堅強和沉著冷靜。

sentences.english: Stay calm and avoid the appearance of hostility or personal rejection.
sentences.chinese: 保持沉著和避免顯露出敵視或個人的鄙棄。

sentences.english: College students are supposed to be calm and cool under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 大學生照理在任何情況下都應保持沉著和冷靜。

definition: (of speech or actions) direct and efficient/without fooling around
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
